value.text: Music and poem Rereading

text:
Texts are images

When discussing Mesoamerican texts, we delve into the hieroglyphs utilized to chronicle their history. For instance, we can examine texts from Copan:
Figure 1: Altar, stele, and the largest hieroglyphic text at the Copan site (Instituto Hondureño de Antropologia e Historia, ). Photo taken on during a visit to the site.
Similar to how our alphabet comprises symbols that construct the sentences we write ("alfabeto", Dicionário da Língua Portuguesa). Mesoamericans also employed symbols (images) to convey their ideas.

Recently, the analyst and disseminator of history Roberto Moras, drawing from various sources, including the work of Laura Laurencich Minelli (Laurencich Minelli, L., ), has taught that the Incas too possessed a system of writing. However, due to the challenge it presents to conventional standards, it has yet to gain widespread acceptance (Moras, Roberto, , Youtube).

A Poetic Structure in Table Form

Many poets adhere to specific metrics when crafting their verses, often resulting in lines with a predetermined number of syllables. For instance, Luís Vaz de Camões employed ten-syllable verses in his renowned work 'The Lusiads' (OLIVEIRA, Raquel T., , pp. 14). This metric can be effectively depicted in a table format, showcasing the syllable count for each line:

VerseNumber of syllables
110
210
310
410
510
Table 1: Syllables per verse in poem 'The Lusíads'.

However, ten-syllable verses are not the only form found in poetry; there are various other metrics to consider. One such example is the 'redondilha' [roundel] ("redondilha", Dicionário da Língua Portuguesa), consisting of verses with either five (minor roundel) or seven (major roundel) syllables. In 'O Labirinto' (Camões, Luís Vaz de, pp. 15 - 16 ; Arruda Franco, M, , pp. 10 - 12) also employed the major roundel:

Corre sem vela e sem leme
o tempo desordenado,
dum grande vento levado;
o que perigo não teme
é de pouco exprimentado
As rédeas trazem na mão
os que rédeas não tiveram:
vendo quando mal fizeram
a cobiça e ambição
disfarçados se acolheram.

First stanza of poem 'Labirinto'.

Furthermore, we can create a table displaying the syllable count present in this poem:

By organizing verses and their corresponding syllable counts in tabular form, we gain a clearer understanding of the intrinsic relationship between these elements within poetry.

In Spanish, the term 'roundel' refers to a poetic form characterized by six (minor roundel) or eight (major roundel) syllables, known as 'redondilla' ("redondilla", Real Academia Española), instead the five and seven syllables.

Visualizing Inter-group Relationships

While tables offer an organized overview of relationships, charts provide a dynamic perspective. To illustrate the correlation between syllables and verses in the poem 'The Lusíads', as presented in Table 1, we will create a chart:

• Define the axis for each group. In this context, syllables will be plotted on the vertical axis, while verses will be displayed on the horizontal axis.
  • Plot the values on the vertical axis, constrained to 10 syllables in this example.
  • Assign values on the horizontal axis, ranging from 1 and 5, corresponding to the verses.
  • Mark intersection points for each value:
    • Begin with 10 on the vertical axis and mark a point where it intersects with the value 1 on the horizontal axis.
    • Then, starting from 10 on the vertical axis, mark an intersection point with the value 2 on the horizontal axis.
    • Repeat these steps for values 3, 4 and 5 on the horizontal axis.
Upon completing these steps, we obtain Chart 1, depicting the relationship between syllables and verses in the poem 'The Lusiads':
Chart 1: Relationship between syllables and verses in the poem 'The Lusiads'.

The Chart 1 summarizes the data from Tabel 1, illustrating the correlation between verse groups and syllable count. Mathematically, this relationship can be represented as f(v) = 10, where v ∈ ℕ (indicating that for each verse v belonging to the set of natural numbers (History Tracers Team, , Walking with the family), there are 10 syllables. In simpler terms, this function denotes that each verse in a ten-syllable poem consists of precisely 10 syllables.).

text.question: Do recent studies indicate that the Incas developed a writing system?
text.additionalInfo: Although there is no doubt that Quipus represent numerical information, it is possible that the Incas used them to convey more information. Recent investigations indicate that the Incas also had a writing system.

text.question: Do the steps involved in tabulating a poem help in understanding the relationship between verses and syllables?
text.additionalInfo: Tabulation is an essential part of the scientific method because it simplifies the visualization of relationships between values by putting numbers side by side and showing how values are connected.

text.question: Apart from tables, can charts be used to visualize the relationship between groups?
text.additionalInfo: There are different ways to express relationships between values; tables and charts are two of the most common.

text.question: Is it possible to mathematically represent the poem 'O Labirinto' as f(v) = 7, where v represents the number of verses and v ∈ ℕ?
text.additionalInfo: It is possible to represent the syllables of a poem using the proposed formula because the poem has 7-syllable lines.

text.question: Can a Portuguese minor roundel poem be expressed as f(v) = 5, where v represents the number of verses and v ∈ ℕ?
text.additionalInfo: As in the previous answer, we can also represent the syllables of a poem using the proposed formula.

text.question: When working with countable quantities, can they be mathematically represented as f(x) = N, where x ∈ ℕ (x is a Natural Number)?
text.additionalInfo: This mathematical representation informs the reader that, for each value of x, the result will always be N; in other words, it remains constant.

text.question: The Chart 2 below displays the first 5 points of the function f(v) = 7, where v represents the number of verses and v ∈ ℕ. Can this chart be associated with the poem 'O Labirinto'?
text.additionalInfo: The poem "O Labirinto" is written with 7-syllable lines, thus the association is valid.
